definitions.definition: in a critical, rough or severe way

examples.text: The report was sharply critical of the police.
‘Is there a problem?’ he asked sharply.

definitions.definition: suddenly and by a large amount

examples.text: Profits fell sharply following the takeover.
The road fell sharply to the sea.
The temperature drops sharply at night.

definitions.definition: in a way that clearly shows the differences between two things

examples.text: Their experiences contrast sharply with those of other children.
She moved sharply across the room to block his exit.
He rapped sharply on the window.
He drew his breath in sharply.

definitions.definition: used to emphasize that something has a sharp point or edge

examples.text: The spring jutted sharply through the mattress.
